$Log: pbs-server.xml,v $ Revision 1.23 2006/10/23 12:43:07 royd Fix for the service pack bug that actually works. Postpone the initialization until the first bootup since we cannot do it in post afterall because then the hostname is localhost which doesn't work with the administrator domains set in pbs.default. This should work for all future "evil" rolls that do insert-ethers --update during post after "chkconfig pbs_server on" is executed. This wouldn't be neccessary if everyone would use --norestart also, but that cannot be assumed.

kickstart.post:
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks set appliance attr compute pbs true
# # Create and define queue default # create queue default set queue default queue_type = Execution set queue default enabled = True set queue default started = True # # Set server attributes. # set server scheduling = True set server acl_host_enable = False set server managers = maui@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; set server managers += root@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; set server default_queue = default set server log_events = 511 set server mail_from = adm set server query_other_jobs = True
#!/bin/sh # chkconfig: 345 85 83 # description: Server for the versatile PBS batch versatile batch system
# Source the library functions . /etc/rc.d/init.d/functions PATH=$PATH:/opt/torque/bin export PATH
# let see how we were called case "$1" in start) echo -n "Starting pbs_server: "
# create a empty server database if one doesn't exist
if [ ! -f /opt/torque/server_priv/serverdb ] ; then /opt/torque/sbin/pbs_server -tcreate # create a default setup if [ -e /opt/torque/pbs.default ]; then /opt/torque/bin/qmgr < /opt/torque/pbs.default > \ /dev/null 2>&1 fi
# # Add the compute nodes to the PBS database with a # database report. # /opt/rocks/bin/rocks report pbsnodes | bash >& /dev/null else daemon /opt/torque/sbin/pbs_server fi echo ;; stop) echo -n "Stopping pbs_server: " /opt/torque/bin/qterm -t quick echo
# # make sure the server is dead # killall -9 /opt/torque/sbin/pbs_server >& /dev/null ;; status) status pbs_server ;; restart) echo "Restarting PBS" $0 stop $0 start echo "done." ;; *) echo "Usage: pbs-server {start|stop|restart|status}" exit 1 esac
/sbin/chkconfig pbs_server on touch /opt/torque/firstboot
# initialize the queuing setup on first boot if [ -e /opt/torque/firstboot ]; then service pbs_server stop rm -f /opt/torque/server_priv/serverdb service pbs_server start rm -f /opt/torque/firstboot fi
*serverHosts: &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; *selectHosts: &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; *selectQueues: default@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;
*sitesInfo: {Local;ICON;&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;;&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;;;;}
[DEFAULT] # set update_node_list to 0 if you do not want automatic updates # to the nodelist when you add or remove nodes. You will then have # to update the nodelist in /opt/torque/server_priv/nodes manually. update_node_list = 1
